title: Michele Pazienza
text:
Michele Pazienza (; born 5 August 1982) is an Italian <a href="Association%20football">football</a> coach, and a former player who played as a <a href="defensive%20midfielder">defensive midfielder</a>.
Career.
Foggia.
Pazienza was born in <a href="San%20Severo">San Severo</a> in the <a href="province%20of%20Foggia">province of Foggia</a>, and grew up in <a href="Foggia%20Calcio">Foggia Calcio</a>'s youth team. He made his debut with the first team in <a href="Serie%20C2">Serie C2</a> in 2000. Pazienza played with Foggia until 2003, scoring 6 goals in 88 appearances, and helping the team reach the promotion play-offs in 2002, and promotion to <a href="Serie%20C1">Serie C1</a> in 2003.
Udinese.
<a href="2003%E2%80%9304%20Serie%20A">The following season</a> he then transferred to <a href="Udinese%20Calcio">Udinese</a>, also making his <a href="Serie%20A">Serie A</a> debut with the club. He made 52 appearances in his two seasons with the club.
Fiorentina.
He left on loan to <a href="ACF%20Fiorentina">Fiorentina</a> for the <a href="2005%E2%80%9306%20Serie%20A">2005–06</a> and <a href="2006%E2%80%9307%20Serie%20A">2006–07</a> seasons for a loan fee of €350,000 annually and was then purchased outright by the club in June 2007 for an additional fee of €3.15 million (a misc. fee that cost "La Viola" an additional €160,000 was later shifted to other company); he made 52 league appearances for "la Viola" in total. During the <a href="2007%E2%80%9308%20Serie%20A">2008</a> winter transfer window, he was purchased by <a href="S.S.C.%20Napoli">Napoli</a> in a -year contract for a transfer fee of €4.25 million. In total, he made 106 appearances for the club, scoring 4 goals.
Juventus.
On 9 June 2011 Pazienza signed a 3-year contract with <a href="Juventus%20F.C.">Juventus</a> on a free transfer. After only making 8 appearances under <a href="Antonio%20Conte">Antonio Conte</a>, he moved on loan from Juventus back to Udinese on 31 January 2012, where he played the remainder of the <a href="2011%E2%80%9312%20Serie%20A">season</a>, making 15 appearances and scoring a goal, for a total of 23 Serie A appearances that season.
Bologna.
On 30 August 2012 he was purchased by <a href="Bologna%20F.C.%201909">Bologna</a> for €300,000 in a 3-year contract, worth €1,081,615 in the first season and €1,261,569 in the second and the third season respectively in gross. The transfer also cost Bologna an additional €366,000 as other fee. Pazienza was ranked joint-4th as the highest earner of Bologna player in 2012–13 season.
Pazienza made 37 league appearances for Bologna in the first 2 seasons. However, he did not play any game in his last year of contract in <a href="2014%E2%80%9315%20Serie%20B">2014–15 season</a>, which the club was relegated to Serie B.
Vicenza & Reggiana.
On 14 July 2015 Pazienza was signed by Serie B club <a href="Vicenza%20Calcio">Vicenza Calcio</a> on a free transfer; he was awarded the number 4 shirt.
On 4 February 2016, he was transferred to <a href="Lega%20Pro">Lega Pro</a> side <a href="A.C.%20Reggiana%201919">Reggiana</a> in a 5-month contract.
In summer 2016, along with other free agents, Pazienza obtained the license to be a youth team coach (UEFA B License).
Manfredonia.
In August he started to train with <a href="Serie%20D">Serie D</a> club <a href="Manfredonia%20Calcio">Manfredonia</a>. He signed a contract on 24 September.
Style of play.
Although Pazienza primarily excelled as a ball winner, and at breaking down opposition attacks, he was also capable of aiding his team offensively, due to his stamina, work-rate, dynamism, finesse, and ability to make attacking runs into the area; he was also able to aid his team creatively and was an effective <a href="Assist%20%28football%29">assist</a> provider.
Coaching career.
Pazienza was promoted to the head coach position at <a href="Serie%20C">Serie C</a> club <a href="A.C.%20Pisa%201909">Pisa</a> from their Under-19 squad on 19 October 2017 following the firing of <a href="Carmine%20Gautieri">Carmine Gautieri</a>. He was dismissed from Pisa on 26 March 2018. On 5 November 2018, he was appointed manager of <a href="Siracusa%20Calcio%20%282013%20club%29">Siracusa</a>. He was fired by Siracusa on 15 December 2018.
